visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart with the title 'Monthly Sales Data'. The chart should have axes and labels styled with a dark gray color (#303030) and a font size of 12px. The data series should include two series: 'Sales 2022' with data [10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40, 45, 50, 55, 60, 65] and 'Sales 2023' with data [12, 17, 22, 27, 32, 37, 42, 47, 52, 57, 62, 67]. The chart should use custom colors ['#008000', '#FFA500'] for the series. Additional configurations should include a white background, a legend positioned at the bottom of the chart, and margins set to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart titled 'Monthly Sales Data'. The chart features two data series: 'Sales 2022' and 'Sales 2023', each with corresponding monthly sales data. The chart's background is set to white, and the margins are adjusted to 50 pixels on all sides for better spacing. The axes and labels are styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 12px, ensuring readability. The legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart, centered horizontally, and styled to match the axes and labels. Custom colors are applied to the series, with 'Sales 2022' in green and 'Sales 2023' in orange, enhancing visual distinction between the two datasets.
